sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"劝说，劝导，劝诱"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: induce, persuade, urge, convince, counsel, coax
means: induce ： 指用讲道理来使某人做某事。
persuade ： 普通用词，指通过劝说、感情交流等而使对方做劝说者所希望的事。
urge ： 语气强，指不断地热情地规劝诱导。
convince ： 指凭行动、事实或言语使他人从思想感情上信服。
counsel ： 较正式用词，指对一些较重大事情所提出的劝告。有时也用于非正式场合，但仍强调严肃的一面。
coax ： 指用好话善意或耐心劝诱、哄骗某人做某事。

sentence.Network_en: He had an urge to open a shop of his own.
He denounces people who urge him to alter his ways.
sentence.Network_cn: 他指责那些督促他改变习惯的人。

sentence.Network_en: Once inside her apartment she felt an urge to brush her teeth.
sentence.Network_cn: 一回到自己的公寓，她就有一种想要刷牙的冲动。

means.word_mean: 催促;激励;促使;大力倡导

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin urgere 'press, drive'

entry.def: If you urge someone to do something, you try hard to persuade them to do it.

example.ex: They urged parliament to approve plans for their reform programme...
example.tran: 他们敦促议会批准他们的改革方案。

example.ex: He urged employers and trade unions to adapt their pay settlements to the economic circumstances.
example.tran: 他敦促雇主和工会根据经济条件调整工资方案。

entry.def: If you urge someone somewhere, you make them go there by touching them or talking to them.

example.ex: He slipped his arm around her waist and urged her away from the window...
example.tran: 他揽住她的腰，拉着她离开了窗边。

example.ex: 'Come on, Grace,' he was urging her, 'don't wait, hurry up.'
example.tran: “快点啦，格雷丝，”他催促道，“别等了。快点。”

entry.def: If you urge a course of action, you strongly advise that it should be taken.

example.ex: He urged restraint on the security forces...
example.tran: 他力主对安全部队设限。

example.ex: We urge vigorous action to be taken immediately.
example.tran: 我们强烈要求立即采取有力措施。

entry.tran: 强烈的欲望；冲动；迫切的要求
entry.def: If you have an urge to do or have something, you have a strong wish to do or have it.

example.ex: He had an urge to open a shop of his own...
I have often talked about why we want to be mothers, but none of us can describe the urge exactly.
example.tran: 我经常谈到我们为什么想做母亲，但没有一个人能准确地描述这种冲动。

means.word_mean: 1. force or impel in an indicated direction;

sentences.sentence: "I urged him to finish his studies"
"The travel agent recommended strongly that we not travel on Thanksgiving Day"

means.word_mean: 3. urge on or encourage especially by shouts;

example.en: Max felt the urge to purge and ran for the john.
example.zh: 麦克斯感到要呕吐，就跑到厕所去了。

auth_sentence.content: We urge the government to fully open its airwaves.
auth_sentence.res_content: We urge the government to fully open its airwaves.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We urge the government to fully open its airwaves.

auth_sentence.content: The urge to create metaphors is difficult to resist.
auth_sentence.res_content: The urge to create metaphors is difficult to resist.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The urge to create metaphors is difficult to resist.

auth_sentence.content: Never ignore the urge to go to the toilet.
auth_sentence.res_content: Never ignore the urge to go to the toilet.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Never ignore the urge to go to the toilet.

Sentence.sentence: He also urged the Federal Trade Commission to set guidelines for social-networking sites.
The paper provides support for newer forms of psychotherapy (心理治疗) that urge people to accept their negative thoughts and feelings rather than fight them.
In fact, their moods turned significantly darker than those of members of the control group, who weren't urged to think positive thoughts.
The urge to quantify is embedded in our society.
The urge to explore space is just the opposite.
They urge the government to revise its existing public policies.

means.word_mean: 力劝; 敦促; 催促

sentences.en: She urged my going to see him immediately.

means.word_mean: 鼓励; 极力主张; 大力推荐

sentences.en: He urged the necessity for immediate action.
sentences.cn: 他强烈要求立即采取行动。

sentences.en: We all urged him to go ahead with his plan.
sentences.cn: 我们都鼓励他实施他的计划。

means.word_mean: 驱策, 促使; 驱赶; 鞭策

sentences.en: Your progress will urge us to work hard.
sentences.cn: 你的进步会促进我们努力学习。

means.word_mean: 强烈的愿望; 强烈的欲望; 冲动

sentences.en: He has an urge to become a film star.
sentences.cn: 他非常希望成为电影明星。

means.word_mean: 驱策；激励；赶紧，加速行动

sentences.cn: 虚心使人进步，骄傲使人落后。

jushi.english: He urged the necessity for immediate action.
jushi.chinese: 他强烈要求立即采取行动。

jushi.english: She urged my going to see him immediately.
